description: This course allows students to explore the history of the American West as a cultural phenomenon. We will focus on key "Western" themes, such as Manifest Destiny, Anglo-American and other racial identities, masculinity, violence, homesteading, the cattle industry, and landscape as developed in a variety of texts and films. Readings may include selections from Lewis and Clark, Parkman's The Oregon Trail, Twain's Roughing It, Wister's The Virginian, Andy Adam's The Log of a Cowboy, L'Amour's Hondo, and at least several chapters from on of the "new" Western histories. Films will include Stagecoach, Shane, The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance, High Plains Drifter, The Ballad of Gregorio Cortez, and Unforgiven. Two short papers on assigned topics; one longer term paper.
name: THE AMERICAN SOUTH
